intro: Dalea wigginsii, commonly known as Wiggins' milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its seed pods are slender and curved, containing several small, hard seeds. Dalea wigginsii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
